Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Parapolybia-MP (natural AMPs; Mastoparan, insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (57.14%) toMastoparan-XA=k: 21%, I=M: 14%.Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 3.9 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 15.6 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 2.9 ug/ml), and B. subtilis (MIC 3.5 ug/ml) (de Souza et al.,2011).In vitro toxicity: human RBC: HC50 306.4 uM; not hemo.lytic (Ye et al., 2023).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 8 mM SDS or 40% TFE.
Literature Information.Author: de Souza BM, Dos Santos Cabrera MP, Neto JR, Palma MS. 2011
Literature Information.Title: Investigating the effect of different positioning of lysine residues along the peptide chain of mastoparans for their secondary structures and biological activities.
